Class SimulatedMessages

java.lang.Object
SimulatedMessages
public class SimulatedMessages extends Object
Simulates a transmission of messages and evaluates the performance of MessagePriorityQueue and MessageHeap
Author:
Rory McGuire

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulatedMessages

      public SimulatedMessages()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Run a simulated transmission of messages to a receiving MessagePriorityQueue. Runs and prints the results (for both MessagePriorityQueue and MessageHeap):
      A single simulation to completion (until the heap or list is empty), A single simulation for a fixed number of iterations, and A number of simulations to completion (the average waiting times are returned)
      Parameters:
      args - [0] the number of "minutes" (iterations) each simulation will run for
      args - [1] the number of messages preloaded in each simulation
      args - [2] the number of complete simulations to be run

    • simToCompletion

      public static double[] simToCompletion(MessageQueue queue, boolean print)
      Runs a simulation of messages and runs them through a MessageQueue until empty, returning the average wait times for each priority level
      Parameters:
      queue - the MessageQueue to be simulated
      print - whether to print out the results
      Returns:
      the average wait times for each priority level

    • sim

      public static double[] sim(int iterations, MessageQueue queue, boolean print)
      Runs a simulation of messages and runs them through a MessageQueue for a fixed number of iterations, returning the average wait times for each priority level
      Parameters:
      iterations - the number of "minutes" (iterations) to run the simulation for
      queue - the MessageQueue to be simulated
      print - whether to print out the results
      Returns:
      the average wait times for each priority level

    • averageArrivals

      public static double[] averageArrivals(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> arrivals)
      Takes a list of arrival times and returns an array of the averages for each respective priority level
      Parameters:
      arrivals - the ArrayList of ArrayLists containing the arrival times at multiple different priority levels
      Returns:
      array of the averages for each respective priority level
